title: Great location and very friendly, helpful front desk staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: First time in Turkey
review: We very recently stayed here and found it to be in a very good, convenient location.  While small, our room was cleaned and tidied every day.  Overall, it is a very good budget type hotel in very good area.

title: A small hotel with huge heart
review: It's just close to most of the attractions. You get there by walking. The view was nice from the roof top. Breakfast was nice and diverse! We had a small room but comfy! The hostages were always friendly. They cleaned the room everyday :)

title: Lovely b&b
review: We chose this hotel because if its excellent location and low cost...we were literally a 5 minute stroll to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and about 7 to the Grand Bazaar. As with most non-chain hotels in Europe, the rooms are small but comfortable. We are a couple who visit new places to see the places, not hang out in the hotel...so Meddusa was perfect...the perfect place from which to explore Old Istanbul. The staff were very kind and went the extra mile. We felt like we were among family...nice family not dysfunctional family. We opted for having breakfast here. It was healthy with extremely fresh produce. We enjoyed the roof top terrace every morning...and one evening took a bottle of wine there. We had it to ourselves as the sun went down. The staff helped us with a corkscrew and glasses. We enjoyed feeling we were part of the community...shop keepers geeting us as we walked through the area. We slept with the window open. Some might not like the street noise but we felt it contributed to our experience of the community. This was no cookie-cutter hotel and we will always fondly remember our time spent here.…

title: Amazing
review: First of all, thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay. Thank you for your nice review.

title: Good service
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Functional "it is was it is hotel" !!
review: We sent only one night at this hotel. I was accompanied by my friend so we needed a room with twin bed, they had only one room available that was a suite so they allotted us that without any additional charge. it was on the top floor. It had a window in the adjacent bedroom giving beautiful view of Blue Mosque. The room door opened in the Restaurant area and a few steps a way was the balcony so we got chance to have beautiful view of Bosporus at night as well as in the early morning. This was something too special about the hotel.  The receptionist on duty on the date of our Check-in and Check-out was Mr.Ali who was an angel. I have no words to thank him for being so nice to us. He made us learn each and everything about Istanbul. He was extremely kind and always willing to help…

title: Amazing stay
review: First of all, I would like to thank you for choosing our hotel for accommodation. Many thanks for a very good reviews.

title: Meddusa hotel very clean
review: It is based right in the old town area within easy walking distance to the main tourist sights, ie Blue Mosque, Palace etc and the Bazaar a must for the ladies literally straight up the road........ Istanbul is a friendly city where we were, however armed security is present everywhere, a sign of the times! Easy to travel on the metro/tram system from the airport but crowded everywhere. Every shop keeper, restauranteur etc wishes to entice you into their establishment. Dont fall for the dropped brush off a trolley routine like i did, in the individuals gratitude (he saw me coming) he insisted to clean my trainers despite my protests not to bother then ask for money, u live and learn !

title: Simple, easy, and great Location!
review: Hello, First of all, I would like to thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay. You write about shops, next time write about the hotel.

title: Very good location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: This hotel are monkey-business, fake, tricker and liar!
review: Very nice and clean rooms staff are very friendly very good breakfast even breakfast on top of hotel has ver nice view of bosphours a magazine ambiance if think to came Istanbul that's will be very nice to fill like your home

title: Excellent
review: Me and my friend reserved this hotel for 09 december to 13 december 2016 after offering it in internet, we believed to reviews and rates. We went to the hotel and saw that hotel is not as in photos in internet. Hotel was very little and has bad smelling and dirty rooms with closed windows and black dirty curtains. Hotel earn money from internet clients and tricks them all. They have Tripadvisor's rating on their desk! I can't believe how Tripadvisor can give them rating? Hotel was very afwul and terrible with bad smelling rooms, dirty curtains and bad personal, they were two guys who are very bad and cruel! Never ever go to Medussa Hotel Istanbul!

title: All-round excellent value for money
review: مكثت في هذا الفندق 13 ليلة، فندق أكثر من رائع، الموقع ممتاز جدا، قريب من كل شيء تريده ( 05 دقائق إلى السلطان أحمد و البازار الكبير، و محطات الترام)، الإفطار ممتاز مع إطلالة ممتازة، فندق هاديء و نظيف،  الموظفون رائعون و خدومين (علي و ساردار)، السعر ممتاز، أنصح به كل من يزور اسطنبول، الغرف ضيقة و لكن هذا حال جميع فنادق اسطنبول. شكرا علي، شكرا ساردار.  I stayed in this hotel 13 nights, more than a great hotel, the location is very excellent, near to everything (05 minutes to Sultanahmet and the Grand Bazaar, and tram stations), breakfast is excellent with a great views, quiet hotel and clean, the staff are great and helpful ( Sardar and Ali), an excellent price, I advise everyone who visits Istanbul. Thank you Ali, thank Sardar.

title: A wonderful experience
review: Prime location (5 minutes walk from Sultanahmet), great buffet breakfast with a view, and unbeatable service at the reception. This hotel is absolute value for money. Highly recommended (esp. to those traveling on a budget but want everything)!

title: Good staying
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: I like this hotel
review: I'm staying at Medusa hotel in Istanbul , it's a nice place , clean & the people here are helpful and nice people , also the breakfast is nice , he is like a motel or hostel in Egypt but here in Istanbul , it call as hotel.

title: Impossible to contact, inflexible, no one speaks English
review: I'm at this hotel right now. It is very close to the famous areas with a nice view on Bosporus (from terrace). The staff is very friendly . Everyone try to do his best to make you happy. Ali and his brother ( reception guy) always give you instructions to enjoy your vacation and how to go to all places and explains on map. They speak English quite enough to reply and understand. I like you all.

title: Perfect location for Old City, tram, ferries and more
review: I had to make a change to a reservation that was booked through Orbitz. These people were impossible to get in touch with and ultimately the reservation was completely lost because they couldn't answer the Orbitz's representatives calls. I called four times and then Orbitz in turn called them 4 times. All 4 times they kept saying the manager wasn't there and to call back.

title: nice and cool.
review: The hotel is good value, the rooms are small but clean. The shower was amazingly powerful and hot. The staff and the breakfasts (with a great view of the Bosphorus) couldn't be better. For a no-frills, cheap place to sleep it is fantastic

title: Travelled as a couple
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice budget stay in the middle of Sultanahmet
review: Stayed 7 nights. Great location we walked everywhere, our room was cleaned everyday, daily breakfast was included plus received one way free airport transfer. Not much variety with the breakfast you pretty much get the same stuff everyday.

title: Perfect place for time and money saving.
review: Very close to the big attractions in Istanbul and close to a tram stop.  Plenty of affordable eating options nearby and the breakfast is sufficient. Room was a little small but fine for the two of us, staff were friendly and helpful although some spoke very little english

title: Visiting
review: I have been staying in Meddusa Hotel 3 times from 2011. In fact, I haven't tried any other hotels in Istanbul. The hotel is beautifully located: very close to Grand Bazar, Sultanahmed square and other historical places of Istanbul. It has great view from the top floor where they serve breakfast. The price of rooms is nothing in comparison to other hotels in the area, especially when you book directly. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Especially, Mr. Sardar at the reception helped us a lot: booked transfer, explained directions, arranged extra service for our kid.

title: Good value in superb location
review: The rooms are small but the location is perfect ! For going out and visiting the old part of the city is the best place to book a room! The people from the hotel are very kind and ready to help you with any type of problems that you may have during your accommodation .

title: Great stay
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A Good Bed & Breakfast
review: Excellent location, next to the bazar and the mosques. Staff is so welcoming and made be feel being at home. I got tea and fruits for free, The view from the roof terrace is great as well. Hamam and the old ottoman café restaurant are around the corner.

title: You get what you pay for... and more!
review: It's near the most important sights on foot, serves nice breakfast, has clean rooms and comfortable beds.  The staff are friendly and helpful. The WIFI is free! As you are in Turkey, you should leave a dollar on the bed when you go sightseeing and you'll surely get your room cleaned with clean towels, etc. You should know, however, that if your room is on the 3rd floor, you may find it noisy as the breakfast room is on the 4th and serves as a café until mindnight.

title: Good price, good location!
review: In this small hotel it is all about location: a few steps away from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Cemberlitas, the Grand Bazar... The building itself is very characteristic, the entrance being just a small door with an even smaller sign on it, covered by a kebab restaurant. Our double room was big enough for two people, with a large, comfortable bed and a private bathroom. The place is very clean, and our bed was made every day. The staff is kind and always present; the wifi works well in every room and in the lobby. Breakfast is served in the morning at the fourth floor, with a panoramic view over Sultanahmet. Very recommended indeed, for both the location and the excellent price (less than 30 euros per night). You won't find easily a better place!

title: Value for money
review: Very close to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia. The hotel is not new, but very clean. The rooms are small but comfortable. The fourth floor, you can have breakfast with terrace. Beautiful view.

title: Don't do it
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Good OGption for the price
review: The only reason we chose this place was because it was near the finish line of the Istanbul Marathon. Except that after the marathon, their water was gone... We had to go across the road to a hammam just for running water, so we didn't seize up after the race. (that cost a fortune too btw) Apparently the water goes at this hotel quite a lot, but the staff didn't mention anything, even when we told them we were running. Also, I woke up after sleeping there with bites which may or may not have come from the bed.  Even though we were on the top floor there was noise above us in the middle of the night too.  Awful place.

title: Inexpencive place to stay in Istanbul
review: We went to Istanbul during busy festive season and holiday, so hotels were not the usual rates.  But this place was a good deal for us.  Its not a luxurious place, but still worth the price.  The best thing about the place is its central location, but not on the busy main street of Sultanahmet.  So you are within walking distance of all attractions minus the usual noise.  They have a rooftop cafe with a good view, but sadly is open only for breakfast.  Another plus is that they have a lift, which can be considered as a luxury as compared to many such hotels in this area.  The two negatives though were the bit hard, old bed, and a very small bathroom.  Everything in there is wet once you take a shower.

title: I would always come back to this hotel
review: Close to Sultanahmet, easy to find from Sultanahmet tram station. However -- next time I'll prefer some nice small hotel at the south side of Sultanahmet. We had two rooms, one twin and one double. Double room was extremly small. Bathroom was quite "interesting" -- there was no separate place for shower, it was just installed aside toilet bowl :-)). Bathroom itself was 1 x 1.5 sq. m or even less. Twin room was in normal size.  Both rooms were marked as "non-smoking" but still smelled a bit smokie :-( And in those "non-smoking" rooms were also ashtraies...  Nice but very small roof terrace for breakfast.

title: Great locatıon
review: This nice, cosy hotel is literally a few minutes away from the most spectacular landmarks of Istanbul but it is located in a quiet street, which is another advantage. The service in the hotel was excellent. To start with the manager, he repiled to all my emails, fulfilled my request about the type of the bathroom and agreed to send me an additional invoice copy by regular post after my visit. The receptionists were also very kind, classy, patient and helpful about all the matters: they arranged a cheap airport transfer and waited with us for the minibus to come, they prepared fresh, tasty breakfast for us earlier than for other guests because of our transfer etc. As advertised, this breakfast is served in a dining room with a nice view over Bosphorus, you can have it on a roof…

title: Good hotel, great service!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Awesome people fantastic service couldn't ask for more!
review: The hotel has an excellent location, all attractions are nearby. The staff was very helpful. The rooms are clean and always cleaned. We spent three nights at the hotel and we hope we can return again.

title: Istanbul and this hotel are fantastic!
review: The hotel itself is not very modern .. But the staff were ace .. I really enjoyed my stay because staff were great .. They go out there way to keep customers happy .. Hussain was fab .. All staff wer very friendly .. Felt right at home :)

title: Excellent servise
review: Hussein was extremely helpful with our requests. We also needed to make some phone calls to the US and Esir offered to make the calls for us free of charge so we could we could reactivate our credit card for Turkey. The breakfast was excellent! Since it was located in such a central location, it was so easy to visit all of the beautiful historical sites. Be sure to take the Bosphorous tour and take care on buying the pass for all of the sites. It is good for 3 days, but not for multiple entrances to the sites.

title: Great location and great staff
review: If you are staying for a couple of days in Istanbul as a tourist and your plan is mostly visit a city around, then Meddusa hotel can be one of the place to stay overnight. Prices are reasonable. Room is not big but also not smallest one, bathroom is also fine. As a PLUS - everyday clean towels. Staff is very friendly, ready to help you with suitcase, open a door everytime and will even try to answer your question. Our receptionist even went out of hotel to walk with us to closed shop as we were having some troubles with travel card. Location is just perfect, walking distance to almost everything. Selection of breakfast is not big but you dont have to worry, sufficient enought, you will not be hungry and your next meal can be your lunch. In general, thanks to welcoming…

title: Great little hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice budget hotel
review: This is a second time we've been in Istanbul and also second time in Meddusa Hotel. This hotel is located in a few minutes walking distance from Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Grand Bazaar. To start with a booking, it is smooth with a fixed prices over the hotel official website. Prices are very reasonable and depend on the time of the year. The responsible person from hotel, in this case Mr. Eser - who speaks perfect English is there to completely help you in any situation. I had a request to be in the same room as last year, Mr Eser fulfilled my wish. Concerning the rooms - they are not very big, but the beds are very confortable, and also very clean. New towels are changed every morning. Hotel has a roof terrace with an incredible view over Bosphorus. The breakfast is included…

title: An Amazing And a Warm Experience - Best Hospitality
review: My family wanted to stay in old town, very close to all tourist attractions. We also had our budget restrictions so Meddusa was perfect place for us. Rooms were neat and clean although little compact. Entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Thanks to Mr Eser and hos colleague  who made our istanbul stay memorable.

title: Perfect location with limited budget
review: I along with my mother travelled to Istanbul from 3 - 9 June 2013 and stayed at Meddusa Hotel. Right from booking the rooms to my stay Mr. Eser and his staff especially Mr Ulubek & Mr. Hussein extended their generous hospitality  and support. The hotel is exactly the same as explained on its website, its location to Sultanhmet, Grand Bazaar and Tramp Station adds to its great accessibility. The entire  staff in the hotel are very warm, cordial and extremely helpful. The entire staff is sensitive to women and old guests. The highlight of the hotel is its Teras Cafe, a roof top cafe with a spectacular view of the Sea and Istanbul. The buffet served is very refreshing and fulfilling , the rooms were well cleaned. I was spell bounded by the honesty, attentiveness and the spectacular…

title: Very good located but very poor rooms
review: If you are looking for a perfect location with limited budget hotel this hotel is exactly for you. It is very close to all main attractions and they have a very good open buffet breakfast in the mornings. It was perfectly fit my needs. I suggest everyone who is looking for a clean hotel, perfect location with limited budget.

title: The best ever!!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Magnifique stay !!! Wish to turn back soon...
review: The hotel was near to Sultanahmet station, and it was very close to every other city's cultural centers as Blue Mosque,Aia Sopfia or Topkapi.The staff was very nice and gentle, and you can enjoy a wonderful view of the Bosphorus.You can find all that in very good price.

title: It's cheap, but a very bad hotel indeed!
review: We stayed in Meddusa Hotel from 15 - 18 February 2013. We had really an enjoyable stay there. The location was ideal, less than 10 minutes from all main historical places like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand bazar, Topkapi Palace, Eminonu harbor for bosphores cruises, etc. The staff was so helpful, friendly and polite persons. The rooms have a great service. clean and fixed every day. The sheets and the towels were like new every day,whiter and profumed. The bufet breakfast was so delicious, u have opportunities to choose what u want to eat. The air conditioning was good and 24 hours open.U can't find smoking areas inside the hallways , it's forbidden. It have safe boxes for precious objects.The terrace had a perfect amazing bosphorus view. The prices were so great. Definitely…

title: Not a safe place to stay
review: We got this hotel by mistake for our last night returning from Athens in order to get out flight early in the morning. Fortunately we had to spend only a half of the night as we had to leave at 3:30. This hotel is possibly the creepiest I've been. The hallways smell cigarettes, the room smells rotten food and the bathroom smells puke, so we had to go to the market nearby and buy an odor neutralizer. Oddly enough it had a good air conditioning unit that cools the room, even during the winter season. Even though the staff are not much prepared some of them are really helpful and polite.

title: Great stay!!!
review: We stayed in the Meddusa just before Christmas, a place we'd been to twice before, and were shocked to wake up one morning and find that someone had been in our room while we were asleep and taken one of our handbags. The receptionist didn't speak much english and kept saying it wasn't a problem. We asked for the manager and were told he wasn't in till lunchtime. In the end we took ourselves off to the local police station and were accompanied back to the hotel by 2 cops. They interviewed the manager who did his best to place the blame on another guest, but there was no evidence of the lock being tampered with, so we can only assume a key was used. Two french ladies on the same floor then told us that someone entered their room at 7am, but they were awake and the intruder fled.…

title: Excellent Value and Service
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Comfortable boutique hotel in central Istanbul
review: I stayed here for two days with my daughter and we were very pleased with the hotel. Yes, it provides basic acommodation, but the employees are exceptionally friendly and helpful. It is located right next to a grocery store and a short walk from the bazaar. The restaurant below the hotel is very good value. It is not the Four Seasons, but I would happily stay here again and recommend it highly to anyone who is looking for a hotel in this price range.

title: Nice and cheap
review: Meddusa Hotel is a small but charming hotel in a nice area in downtown Istanbul, with attractions such as Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque within a five minutes walk. The employees are very welcoming, and despite certain language challenges, truly tries to make the stay as pleasant as possible.  The rooms (we stayed there twice, and tested three different rooms) are simple yet comfortable, and completely unaffected by noise. The AC was pretty good, but the wifi access rather poor. The breakfast was good yet quite simple, but the visitor inevitably becomes distracted by the magnificent view from the restaurant terrace.   In conclusion, this hotel offers a good location and is well worth its reasonable price.

title: Small, cramped and noisy
review: The hotel is located in the heart of Sultanahmet, it takes just 10 min to get to the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and other sites. Rooms are very-very small but have everything you need to stay for couple of days: AC, TV-set, clean sheets, free WiFi. Breackfast is included in the room fee, they serve eggs, fresh bread, vegetables, watermelons, ham and cheese plus hot beverages. The hotel is ideal for the tourist with small budget.

title: good hotel
review: Small, cramped and noisy. On the first day our room had a view of the septic tank, and the triple room was so small it had no room to even put one suitcase on the floor, let alone 3. I had to do gymnastic contortions in order to reach my bed. No table/chair or mirror due to the size. The bathroom (complete with leaky toilet, though luckily only leaked clean water) was so tiny you had to shower over the toilet, wet room style, soaking everything. The lift was right outside the room, and we heard every movement and every conversation of every person who walked in, and the door rattled constantly.    Luckily on day 2 we were moved (after I complained) to “the best room in the hotel”, it was a family room so reasonably spacious, and had a normal bathroom (though still leaky). Even…

title: One of the worst nights of my life...
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: best catch for the price / budget travellers
review: It was like something out of a film. Luckily we only had to spend a night there after a mix up with booking our original hotel (The Modern Sultan, much, much better)  The room is a joke, measures about 2 meters by 3 metres, with dilapidated furniture and a general grubby appearance. And the bathroom? It was so small I could sit on the toilet, brush my teeth in the sink and have a shower ALL AT THE SAME TIME!!  It was very noisy, with a main street right outside the building, so plenty of traffic. We could clearly hear people stomping around the hotel until the early ours of the morning. And the lift? Enough room for one person, and no door to the cubicle, so you're seeing bare stone pass 2 inches from your nose.  On the plus side, the terrace was nice.

title: A trip to remember
review: it was a good location and easy access to all attractions and walking distance from old city of istanbul & easy access also to the local tram.   Room was nice and clean and the staff were very friendly and generous,.. they spoke english which was really helpful and a relief.. after a bad experience @ the airport.  I would like to recommend this hotel to budget travellers especially after the new management took over as I was informed by Mr. Eser Akkoc.

title: what a trip. :-)  amazing hotel with very good price
review: My family and I just got back from Istanbul. It's a beautiful city.. we had so much fun. The hotel was in a great location, amazing view to the city and it was so easy to go anywhere from there.  People are so friendly and they offered the best service. Also it came to my attention that the staff were communicating in English with westerns, which made us comfortable to ask for any assistance.  I highly recommend tourists to book in Meddusa Hotel. you wont regret it :)  Special thanks to Mr. Eser  Akkoc and his new management team who have been a great help to us.  We will definitely go again!

title: Wouldn't recommend to anyone
review: From where to begin, first of all as soon as we arrived the hotel staff were very welcoming to me and my family and I had a long trip with my kids, they took care of everything in just 15 min I was in my room....  As room it was nice and bright clean and smelling good. But for us the most important thing for me was the location which it was close to all the attraction places in Istanbul only walking distance from every where actually ..  The thing I knew that they have new management that they r doing there bet to decrease all the issues that they have before and I see it working I guess , all of them speaks English and very friendly specially Mr. Esser akkoc he was really nice   Bottom line its worth the money and for these reasons location location and location :-). Plus the…

title: ok for the money
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: AFTER READING THE MOSTLY  POSITIVE REVIEWS WE WEREN'T READY FOR THIS...
review: Eventough I asked for a non smoking room when we entered the room you could feel the smoke all over the sheets, curtains and pillows. there is no non smoker room i guess. even the common areas are smelly. the stuff smoke for 24 hours. cleanliness is an other issue. cant tell it was clean at all. breakfast was ok. actually it was more than I expected.location is a bit over the hill so u need  to climb.rooms are tiny and shower is not well covered so water comes inside of the room. stuff is ok but cant speak english. in general if u r going to such a place u dont expect much. it could be a bit cleaner but its fine. ok for value of money u give.

title: The worst hotel I've seen so far
review: To premise this review I would like to say that my friend and I have extensively travelled the world on a right budget being early twenty year old students but even for the low price and good location we won't be back. As other reviewers have said the staff don't really speak English which although isn't their fault it is expected in order to own a "hotel". The breakfast also isn't flash but hey we still didn't really mind it was cheap an we are young! However the elevator is literally the size of a shoebox and hideously unsafe with NO DOOR! again we breathed in and relaxed and thought it's not that bad. The rooms are tiny, if one person wants to walk around the room the other must sit on the bed, literally as one reviewer said 2m by 2m. Again I thought it's cheap. It got worse,…

title: Average
review: The only good point of this hotel is the surroundings, the hotel is well located, near all historical city sites ( Sultanhamet, Blue mosquee,Grand Bazar,etc...) Generally speaking, the hotel is old, and not well equiped. The best is to look at the photos I've posted, they describe quite well what we had to face. The rooms are really tiny (so does the elevator where 2 people have to kiss each other to fit), so tiny that you cannot go round your own bed. The rooms are not dirty, but could still be cleaner ( some strange stains on the celing). Half of the indirect lights didn't work. The room smelled tobacco from the moment we wakled in, although we had booked a non smoking room.  There was no window in our room, the only opening was a strange door that was welded (we couldn't open…

title: Good location, okay for the money
review: I stayed alone in the Medussa Hotel for three nights in September 2011 whilst sightseeing in Istanbul. I booked this hotel after reading positive feedback on this site. I paid Euro 60 per night for a single room with breakfast. The hotel is in an erxcellent centrally located location. You are 400 metres from the Sultanamet are which has all the historical sites. The Grand bazaar is 100 metres away.  My room was simple but clean and the bed comfortable. I didn't find the staff to be as helpful as other reviewers but they did enough. Breakfast was, in my opinion, poor. I didn't bother after the first morning.  If you want a cheap place to stay in the centre then this is fine. If you want more comfort and a better breakfast, go elsewhere and pay a bit more.

title: Great location, hotel is "roughing it"
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Cramped everywhere - In the rooms, toilets and lift!
review: Super location 3 blocks from Grand Bazaar and walking distance to most other attractions. Rooms VERY cramped; bathroom with handheld shower that wets down the entire room; rooms not cleaned or beds made on a daily basis. Congenial and helpful management though. Elevator works sporadically.

title: The way budget hotel should be....
review: To start with, there are good chances you could walk past the hotel without realizing the same! The hotel block is barely 4-5 meters wide and you can guess the room sizes.  We had booked two rooms and were offered two 2m x 2m match boxes. Word of caution for ones with big or multiple suitcases, might have to step through them to reach your bed! Be prepared to have your bathrooms ankle length drenched while managing to bath.  Well for transporting your luggage, you have an option of traveling single with a mid size suitcase or letting your bags travel while you run 3 to 4 floors up and collect them.  Check-in was ok. The lone solace was our breakfast with views of the Marmara Sea. However, as realized later, the views are a common feature available in most of Sultanahmet hotels. …

title: a very nice hotel with wonderful atmosphere
review: Great location, nice, clean, friendly. Even minibar with well priced drinks.

title: Best location & best staff - a definite "Yes"
review: We stayed in the Hotel for 1 week and we had just a wonderful stay there. Though the room was small, but it was very tidy and we felt like we were at home:) nice and very friendly staff, every day cleaning, good terrace with wonderful sea view, good breakfast. Pick-up and transfer from/to airport were also organized very properly. If I go to Istanbul again I will stay in this Hotel only! :)

title: Great location
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: A good camp to explore the city
review: A nice 3-star hotel for the budget minded.  Friendly staff, who tries their best in a broken English.  Small rooms, clean and relatively well kept. Breakfast offers the usual plus fresh fruit of the season, in our case strawberries en masse.  Unic selling point is the roof top terrace with a view over the Bosperous, where the breakfast is served. Turkey has introduced a no smoking policy in public rooms, whereas all rooms and other inside areas are non smoking.

title: Great little budget hotel
review: The location is excellent to visit Sultanahmet (but Beyoglu is more  strategic for night life). One of the things that we liked most was breakfast from the rooftop with its beautiful view.  Staff were kind and helpful.

title: No reservation, despite a confirmed booking
review: We have stayed at Medussa twice, and will go back again. It's small, clean, comfortable,  and close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and the tram stop.  It has a roof top breakfast room/terrace with views of the Bosphorus, and they serve a decent turkish breakfast. What more could you want?

title: Small, simple Hotel close to major sights
review: We made a reservation at the Meddusa a month before our stay in Istanbul. When we arrived (armed with all our print outs of the confirmed booking), we were given a shake of the head as the hotel was full.   It was difficult to understand what the problem was as the hotel person didn't speak very much English and I can't speak Turkish (I don't blame the hotel for my lack of Turkish!). We were eventually helped with our bags to another hotel nearby (Hotel Aquarium) and this place was very disappointing. I can't leave any feedback about Meddusa Hotel as a place to stay but as a place to make bookings with, our experience has been very poor. I would recommend that any 'confirmed' online bookings are checked and double checked before you arrive.

title: No rooms left in the hotel when we arrived!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great location
review: We arrived at midnight at the hotel only to be told we had no room, complete with a 3 and 8 year old.They apparently were full up.  They had "checked" my credit card the day before and said it had not worked (never not worked before and it worked perfectly at several locations in istanbul the time we were there).They did not send an email or try to contact me to say they would be giving our room away.However they did find us another room in another hotel.This was a tiny room with 2 single beds.Not very good for 2 adults and 2 children(hardly slept) Not in the same place either.The staff were friendly and appologised but if my husband hadn`t been turkish i don`t know what we would have done as the staff on the night of our arrival spoke turkish only.When it came to paying (The…

title: nicest people ever!
review: Good Points: Fantastic location - can walk everywhere within 5 mins Cheap - we paid about 40-50euro per room per night Nice/helpful staff Nice breakfast terrace (simple breakfast - bread etc)  Bad points: Shower was over sink/toilet -wet floor - bathroom v small No window in our room but others had windows Room was v small - had to shuffle around bed Could smell smoke sometimes even though it was non-smoking room  BUT overall, if you're not bothered by the points above and you just plan to sleep there it's great! Not for a luxury romantic honeymoon but definitely worth it for a budget city break.   TIP! Only pay 20 lira for the shuttle to Sabiha Gokcen airport and don't buy anything at the Grand Bizarre, it's a total ripoff - can buy exactly the same thing at little shops around…

title: exelent location
review: I stayed one week at this hotel and it was perfect! the location couldn't be better. It's located in Sultanhamet, walking-distance from main touristic places. We walked everywhere (and it was very close to Tramway). Staff was extremely kind and always willing to help me and my friends. I recommend this place!

title: Good value, walk anywhere, ask anything.
review: exelent location and very nice wiew.room was small but staff was very helpfull....................................................

title: Just fantastic!
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Very friendly staffs and best location
review: Thanks to all the staff who work in this amazing hotel. Guys - you are great! The location is superb in the old city of Sultanahmet. The hotel is small and cozy with a family atmosphere. It's very, very clean - thanks to a cleaning lady - she does so much, i could never expect such services from a 2 star hotel! Great! The rooms have all the facilities that you can expect from a 4 star hotel - new furniture, good repairment, a hairdyer, a TV, a fridge which is like a mini-bar, the towels are changed every day, you can have breakfast which is included in the price on a wonderful terrace with Bosphorus view. They serve a typical turkish breakfast which consists of olives, cheese, vegetables, butter, jam, yoghurt, cereal, juice, tea and instant coffee ( that's the only minus i can…

title: Wonderful location, great staff
review: I travelled to Istanbul with my family for 7 day and stayed at the Meddusa Hotel. We were in the family room which was basic, not big, but always very clean. The breakfast was correct. We got recommandation from our friend in Paris who stayed also in the same hotel with his family.  The hotel is situated in a nice small street, about 5 minutes walk to Topcapi palast and Hagia Sophia, it also has a wonderful view of the Bospherous sea via the terrace.  What we like the most was the friendly family atmosphere and the warm attitude of the staffs. I have booked the hotel via telephone and email via Deniz, who was always very friendly and helpful. As we arrived at the Atatürk airport, we were waited as the hotel would offer the free airport transport service. It is very nice when you…

title: It's a amazing experince for me to stay...
review: Meddusa Hotel is located right in the heart of historic Istanbul, moments away from Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar and the price is truly wonderful.  You get breakfast included every morning on their terrace and each room has a bathroom and two beds.  But the best part of the hotel has to be the staff.  My husband and I got separated from our luggage on our way from New York (JFK) and had only the clothes on our backs and two carry-on suitcases for our first day in Istanbul.  We also had a number to call at Ataturk Airport to check if our bag arrived the next morning but unfortunately no one at the airport lost and found spoke English well enough for us to communicate.  The hotel staff intervened and did all the talking for us, got us a cab to…

title: a beautiful place
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Not bad for that  money ....
review: I recommend this hotel at all. The staff is very nice, smily and effective.

title: Such a lie!
review: Meddusa Hotel - Istanbul centre - Oct 07-Oct 11, 2009. Actually the hotel is not bad for 40Euro in peak season. The worst part is the shower - no curtain no tub - so when you have the shower - everything around is wet including towels and toilet paper. The stuff is rather helpful. The breakfast is very simple: bread, chease, tomatoes, eggs (boiled and fried), jam, grapes, tea, coffee. What else do we need? The open terrace view is terrific. These is a nice restourant next door, just a good place to have you evening beer and kebab. So, if you come to Istanbul just for sightseeing to catch the last simmer days - Meddusa hotel is not bad choice, just not expect too much!  Oh, they do love CASH, so they pretend as if their card terminal doesn't operational, be ready and do not check…

title: I could never imagine a worse hotel.
review: I found this hotel on hostelbookers.com. The price of airport pickup service was totally wrong. Every time I emailed them, the more price they gave me.  Also that place should not be called "HOTEL", should be "HOSTEL!!!!". Such a tiny room with a evaculate door. Can't walk at all in the room. So how can we exit when something happens? Ensuit room has tiny toilet with shower, which water went everywhere... well...so depressing for my frist staying. If this is a cheap hostel, no complain. But found much much nicer hotel at the same price afterwards... So I got to say something for others.

title: loud noisy clean rooms
review: we have 2 airport in istanbul .she never want understand us.when she check out she want to discount about room price we did not accept best regards deniz akkoc

title: Great Location - Great Value
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Nice Budget Preference
review: Rooms very clean, beds very comfortable - easy walking distance to top sites/restaurants/shopping, etc.   Small  roof terrace with wonderful views of Bosphorus where you can have a great breakfast.   Staff friendly and helpful.   Excellent 2 Star hotel.  Chris and Veronica

title: I wouldn't recommend to anyone!
review: Stayed in Meddusa for only 1 night in October 2009. There is nothing to complain about this hotel. Hotels in istanbul is overpriced and if you are looking for a nice and cozy sleep in a budget with own ensuite, then this is the one . This small hotel is just 5 minutes walk from Sultanahmet tram stop, although you need to do a bit of searching before you can locate it. The stairs leading to the hotel is a bit doggy, a small reception area and an even smaller room . Our twin room on the third floor is very small but clean , just have enough room to manuvoure and the bathroom is even worst, hardly any room even for Asians. But if you are looking to stay Sultanahmet area and don't want to pay more then this is the choice. The owner, Deniz is very friendly and breakfast was served on…

title: Great location, great value
review: Bad points: Extremely small rooms, many mosquitoes at night, no water for 24 hours during our stay of 4 nights, not clean bed linen, torn towels. Good point: Location. Typical Turkish breakfast (but the food is low quality) is served in a terrace with nice view.  The reviews that I read about Meddusa before booking the hotel were, overall, very good. But I was terribly disappointed with the hotel. I believe I can evaluate this hotel fairly as it was the second (two star) hotel  that I stayed in the same (Blue Mosque) region within one month.   In Meddusa I stayed for four nights with my girlfriend. The first shock was the extremely small room; I went down the reception and asked if they could change the room. The receptionist said that they are aware that their rooms are small…

title: Would I stay again or recommend to friends ? No
review: I had a quite satisfactory week-long stay at the Meddusa. The place is a bit threadbare and my room (first floor on street side) was not as quiet as I'd have liked. But great location, friendly staff (not great English skills), clean (but a bit threadbare) room. Breakfast never changes but includes cornflakes as well as the usual yogurt/cheese/bread/cukes/tomatoes/olives/tea/instant coffee/juices. Terrace view is not the best but lets you survey the day's weather. Plenty of free drinks stocked in the refrigerator. Wifi worked well in my room. I was able to use my T-Mobile phone to make free US calls via wifi. Starbuck's and several nice sidewalk cafes are a block away on the pedestrian mall part of the street, just before the Mosque courtyard that leads to the covered bazaar…

title: Very good place
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Great stay
review: A lovely location for a short stay in Istanbul. It's not on a slope, so that's a big plus. Deniz is very kind and friendly. Breakfast is on the terrace and there's instant tea available. I also liked the yogurt with honey available every morning. The slightly down point is that the room can be a little small. And the only chair we had in the room had 3 legs, so it was wobbly.

title: Great budget hotel
review: If you look for a cozy, low budget hotel, Meddusa is the right place for you. The rooms are not very big but very clean with fresh towels every day. The place is very near to all the main sights in Sultanahmet, no need to use the public transport.  Staff was very friendly, willing to help in every situation, so we wish to thank them for the pleasant stay.

title: Friendly Staff, Free Wi-Fi and Clean to boot
review: If, like us, you don't spend much time in your hotel room, but just want somewhere to sleep that's safe, clean, and in a good location. ..... then look no further.  The rooms are small, with not much furniture, but not a big deal. The staff are very friendly, especially the morning guy (one of the evening guys, not so much). Great location, OK breakfast, and a nice view from the terrace. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely budget accommodation
review: I have never done a review and I went through the rigmarole of signing up just to get the word out for this place. The staff was so friendly and accomodating that I want to return all they did for for me and give them the great review they deserve. The free breakfast was substantial and they served free coffee or tea all day and night on their upstairs patio with a great view. There was free Wi-Fi in the room that always had a great connection. Safety and cleanliness were never in question.

title: Very good hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: good value for money
review: The hotel is okay for the price. The location is perfect, everything is reachable in 5 minutes. Rooms are clean and big enough. The staff is nice and friendly.

title: Cheap and good hotel to stay for budget travellers!
review: Very nice and clean hotel with friendly staff and in perfect location - close to the best tourist attractions. Sometimes it was difficult to communicate in English but it was also a good experience.  There's a superb view from the terrace where breakfasts are served.

title: simple accomodation with excellent location and friendly staff
review: The hotel is hard to locate and a couple of locals have to help me before I finally managed to find it..It doesn't look impressive from the outside, and for a minute or two, I hesitated about checking in!! Initially, I thought there would be problems checking-in as there were some miscommunications regarding my reservations 4days prior to my arrival. But, I was surprised the hotel Manager remembered me (due to that miscomm!!).. I was given the kinda room which I had requested: Double-bed, smoking and one with a good view. It was facing the street outside..fantastic!! They rushed the housekeeper into cleaning my room as I was quite early to arrive. In 15minutes, it was done and when i was brought up to the room, I was shocked with the its tiny size, and its tiny dressing table.…

title: Meddusa: Use it myself and recommend it to my friends!
review: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel, it is ideal for travellers willing to discover the historic Istanbul and look for a nice budget accomodation. It is in walking distance from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and you can easily reach other parts of the city by public transport, there is a tramway line and a bus terminal (Beyazit) in the near. The rooms are  basic but clean and comfortable with a small bathroom.  Breakfast is served on the roof-terrace, which has a great panorama on the Bosporus and Golden Horn. You can find fresh cheese, vegetables, yoghurt, muesli and marmalade every morning with tea, coffee, orange juice. The staff is especially friendly and helpful, although not everyone speaks english.  The restaurant downstairs (Buhara) has a very good kitchen…

title: Excellent budget accomodation
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.

title: Meddusa has everything
review: Hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet within easy walking distance of all major places of interest.  Very friendly, helpful staff who speak good English.  Small ensuite room with tv, cleaned & provided with fresh towels daily.  Very good breakfast, served in top floor dining room which has a terrace with good views of the Bosphorus and the city.  Would highly recommend and will use again

title: Really "balanced" hotel!
review: I stayed for 11 days in Meddusa Hotel I really enjoyed each and everyday of my staye. When I say it has everything I am referring the followings: (1) The cost is good, (2) It is located at the centre of those Historical places so you do not worry about transport to go to these places, such as Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc. (3) It has a fantastic sea view. (4) Very friendly staff who always try to make your stay comfortable and they very good with information, such as directions, where to do shopping even they arrange for you somebody who can assist you in shopping.

title: thanks meddusa hotel
review: "Meddusa" hotel is the exellent place to stay if you plan to get "budget, but lovely and clean" place. Location is perfect - easy to find from the very first day in Istanbul. Just one block from Aya Sofia and etc. (biggest attactions), 5 min. from tramstation.  Actually  "Meddusa" is placed in pretty unique location in terms that it is actually in the very historical center, but in the same time is on green quiet boulevard which leads to Grand Bazaar. Staff of "Meddusa" is trully helpful and heartful. They are ready to solve any problem within hotel, to give advice or explanation on local things and routes. The room was cleaned every day, tolwels were changed. The room itself was small, but not too much. Breakfast is served on top floor with terrace, you can observe Bosforus…

title: Good hotel for money
review: We really enjoy staying in Meddusa hotel. it's near to main tourist attraction, it's safe on day and on night and have an excellent service and quality. The Hotel's staff are very generous, frendly and helpful like almost turkish people. they speak english and a little arabic.  The hotel has un great view in the breakfast area and a free internet connection.

title: Very nice location and staff
review: With so many unmissable attractions within a mere stroll of each other – and all set around the site of an ancient Byzantine hippodrome – Sultanahmet is an overwhelmingly popular tourist destination, and a prime location for visitors to be wowed on a truly epic scale. Beyond the wonders of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and more, this relatively small area of Istanbul somehow manages to retain an air of peace and calm. It offers visitors a significantly less celebrated but nonetheless pleasant network of quaint lanes and side streets, majestic panoramas of the Bosphorus, and an impressive assortment of accommodation options for all budgets and tastes.
